commitResults.messageBody:
Remove `--assets` mentions in UG and restructure customizing-reports
page

Add node_modules to pagesExclude to prevent unnecessary md detection.
Reorganized the customization guide sections with better naming and
hierarchy.

This PR adds a repository-specific guidance file to improve
AI-assisted development (e.g., GitHub Copilot).

It documents RepoSenseâ€™s architecture, coding standards, project
patterns, development workflow, and CI/CD practices, helping AI tools
generate suggestions aligned with existing design decisions.

This improves suggestion quality, reduces review effort, and lowers
the onboarding cost for new contributors.

The MacOS13 runner image is not be supported
by GitHub and may cause our CI/CD check to suspend.

Let's update the integration.yml and remove the runner image.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2429] Allow different time period for different repos in report-config.yaml (#2490)
commitResults.messageBody:
Add since and until field in report-config.yaml under branches

Previously, the report-config.yaml doesn't support different time periods for 
different repos and relied on CLI flags for all repos.

Add two optional fields (since, until) with the format
- dd/MM/yyyy
- dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm
- dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss

Rename title.md

This pull request updates the dashboard's introductory section to use
`intro.md` instead of the legacy  `title.md`, improving clarity
across documentation, frontend, and backend code. Legacy support for
`title.md` remains for backward compatibility, but
users are encouraged to migrate to `intro.md`. 

The changes also update documentation to reflect this new approach
and clarify the difference between the browser tab title and the
dashboard intro section.

Update link to vue3

The link of vue.js tutorial links to vue2, but vue2 is outdated 
and vue3 is actually used in reposense.

Let's update the link to vue3 on vue master.

Add GitHub Pages deployment instructions

The current User Guide does not mention that users need to deploy
GitHub Pages to view their report, nor does it explain how to do so.

Let's add instructions with a link to the official GitHub Pages 
documentation for completeness.

Remove faulty IOException test for missing summary.json

The test fails when frontend/public contains report data, which gets
included in templateZip.zip during the build process.

Let's remove
generateReposReport_isOnlyTextRefreshedTrueButInvalidPath_throwsIoException

Since the validation logic is straightforward, setting up additional
test setup is not worth the complexity.
